title: Ron Climie
summary: Ronald Malcolm Climie (born March 4, 1950) is a Canadian former professional ice hockey player who played 249 games in the World Hockey Association (WHA).  He played for the Ottawa Nationals in the WHA's inaugural (1972–73) season, then the Edmonton Oilers and New England Whalers. He also played in the first two WHA all star games. Climie was the Oilers' team-scoring champion in their second (1973–74) season.
content:
Ronald Malcolm Climie (born March 4, 1950) is a Canadian former professional ice hockey player who played 249 games in the World Hockey Association (WHA).  He played for the Ottawa Nationals in the WHA's inaugural (1972–73) season, then the Edmonton Oilers and New England Whalers. He also played in the first two WHA all star games. Climie was the Oilers' team-scoring champion in their second (1973–74) season.
